subject: Re: [junit] Need some detailed example of ParameterizedTestSuite
msgSnippet: ... I m flattered that people continue to use the codebase, even though it s been mostly dead for several years. Unfortunately, no documentation beyond what
messageBody:
Narasimha_Tadepalli@... wrote:

> thanks for the response. This is the link I am refering to.
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com/toolkit/apidocs/com/diasparsoftware/util/
> <http://www.diasparsoftware.com/toolkit/apidocs/com/diasparsoftware/util/>
> junit/ParameterizedTestSuite.html

I'm flattered that people continue to use the codebase, even though it's
been mostly dead for several years. Unfortunately, no documentation
beyond what you found exists, and I don't plan to write any. (I just
don't have time.) I recommend you look at the source, which is also
available online at

http://diasparsoftware.com/toolkit/xref/index.html

to learn how to use this class. I have to admit, it was experimental, so
I can't offer any guarantees as to its suitability, but it worked well
in simple cases.

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
